title_localized.en: Luck of the Irish: The New York City St. Patrick’s Day Parade

image.name: 6a0168e4f9b314970c01b7c94f9878970b-500wi
image.alt: Luck of the Irish: The New York City St. Patrick’s Day Parade

meta_description_localized.en: Set your sights on all things green this March at the New York City St. Patrick’s Day Parade.

post_content_localized.en:
Set your sights on all things green this March at the New York City St. Patrick’s Day Parade.

The New York City St. Patrick’s Day parade has been marching since 1762 – and is one of the city’s oldest and proudest Irish traditions. Over 1 million spectators can’t be wrong – Erin Go Bragh!

The Parade takes place on Saturday March 17, 2018 at 11am with more than 150,000 marchers, bands and bagpipes and can be viewed an be viewed along 5th Avenue between 44th Street and 79th Street

The New York City St. Patrick's Day Parade marched for the first time more than 250 years ago, on March 17, 1762 - fourteen years before the Declaration of Independence and is run completely by volunteers.

Everyone at The Manhattan Club is excited about the New York City St. Patrick’s Day Parade – where everyone can be Irish for the day! Why not plan your trip to enjoy the event and reserve your stay with us in Midtown Manhattan to take advantage of all of the St. Patrick’s Day and other events in the city? Also taking place that same weekend is the New York International Children’s Film Festival and the New York Botanical Garden Orchid Show. Enjoy the events or just take in the city at your own pace.
